snippet: The massive leak of toxic coal ash into the Dan River had dwindled, but workers had yet to seal the breach in a drainage pipe where the leak was detected more than four days ago.
abstract: Massive leak of toxic coal ash from Duke Energy's retired North Carolina power plant into Dan River dwindles, but hundreds of workers have yet to seal the breach in a drainage pipe where the leak was detected more than four days earlier.

byline.original: By MICHAEL WINES and TIMOTHY WILLIAMS

lead_paragraph: The massive leak of toxic coal ash into the Dan River had dwindled, but workers had yet to seal the breach in a drainage pipe where the leak was detected more than four days ago.

headline.main: Huge Leak of Coal Ash Slows at North Carolina Power Plant
headline.print_headline: Huge Leak of Coal Ash Slows at North Carolina Power Plant
